The company is an end-to-end online gambling provider, creating its own game software and backends, and offering play to the public via its own servers. With the exception of Active Directory services, the company's entire server collection of approx 60 machines runs Unix. For one year I was the sole Unix Admin. At the time I started, the company had far outgrown its existing IT systems, so in addition to the general day-to-day maintenance tasks, I have been designing and implementing improved systems, as well as new ones.
